pt.runtime

Class TaskpoolLIFOWorkFirstLocal

  • java.lang.Object
    • pt.runtime.AbstractTaskPool
      • pt.runtime.TaskpoolLIFOWorkStealing
        • pt.runtime.TaskpoolLIFOWorkFirstLocal
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Taskpool

    public class TaskpoolLIFOWorkFirstLocal
extends TaskpoolLIFOWorkStealing
    Author:
    Weng Hao Work-First - Local Task Queue Control. Variation of the WorkStealing task scheduler. While this implementation initially follows the behaviour of the WorkStealing task scheduler, there is a restriction enforced on each of the local one-off task queues. Each local one-off task queue can only enqueue a limited number of tasks, this limitation is limited by the localThreshold variable. If the number of tasks in a local one-off task queue exceeds this threshold, then the task queue is no longer able to enqueue any other tasks until the number of tasks no longer exceeds this threshold. Tasks assigned to these task queues during this period will be processed directly by the worker thread that is designated to the affected task queue. The intention for this restriction is to reduce the overall congestion in the task scheduler. By forcing workers to directly process certain tasks, this will reduce the overall number of tasks enqueued in the task scheduler in an attempt to improve the overall performance in fine-grained nested parallelism.

    • Constructor Detail

      • TaskpoolLIFOWorkFirstLocal

    • Method Detail

      • enqueueReadyTask

        protected void enqueueReadyTask(TaskID<?> taskID)
        When enqueuing a task in the WorkStealing policy, if the task is not able to be executed on any arbitrary thread, regardless of the type of enqueuing thread it will be enqueued to the privateQueue of the thread in charge of executing that task. However, if a task can be executed by arbitrary threads, then if the task is a TaskIDGroup it will be enqueued to the globalMultiTask queue, otherwise if the enqueuing thread is a Worker Thread and is not a MultiTaskWorker thread, it will enqueue the task to the head of its local queue. For other cases where the enqueuing thread is a MultiTaskWorker thread or is not a Worker Thread, the task will be enqueued to the tail of a random thread's localQueue.
        Overrides:
        enqueueReadyTask in class TaskpoolLIFOWorkStealing
        Since:
        10/9/2014

      • setThreshold

        public static void setThreshold(int threshold)
        Assigns the threshold value that is used to determine the number of tasks to be enqueued, before Work-First is enforced. In TaskpoolLIFOWorkFirstLocal, the setThreshold() and getThreshold() refers to the number of allowable tasks that a local one-off task queue can enqueue at any one time before it must process tasks directly. The default value for the localThreshold is 5.
        Parameters:
        threshold -

      • getThreshold

        public static int getThreshold()
        Returns the current threshold value set for the given task scheduler. In TaskpoolLIFOWorkFirstLocal, the getThreshold() refers to the number of allowable tasks that a local one-off task queue can have in their queue at any one time before it must process the next task directly.
        Returns:
